data.title: 键入缺少的字母，完成下面的文字
data.blankContent: In massive stars, the core is already large enough at the onset of the hydrogen burning shell that helium ignition will occur before electron degeneracy pressure has a chance to become prevalent. Thus, when ____ stars ____ and ____, ____ do ____ brighten ____ much ____ lower-mass ____; ____, ____ were ____ brighter ____ lower-mass ____ to ____ with, and ____ thus ____ brighter ____ the ____ giants ____ from less-massive stars. These stars are unlikely to survive as red supergiants; instead they will destroy themselves as type II supernovas.
data.partBlankContent: In massive stars, the core is already large enough at the onset of the hydrogen burning shell that helium ignition will occur before electron degeneracy pressure has a chance to become prevalent. Thus, when th___ stars exp___ and co__, th__ do n__ brighten a_ much a_ lower-mass st___; how____, th__ were mu__ brighter th__ lower-mass st___ to be___ with, and a__ thus st___ brighter th__ the r__ giants for___ from less-massive stars. These stars are unlikely to survive as red supergiants; instead they will destroy themselves as type II supernovas.
data.fullContent: In massive stars, the core is already large enough at the onset of the hydrogen burning shell that helium ignition will occur before electron degeneracy pressure has a chance to become prevalent. Thus, when these stars expand and cool, they do not brighten as much as lower-mass stars; however, they were much brighter than lower-mass stars to begin with, and are thus still brighter than the red giants formed from less-massive stars. These stars are unlikely to survive as red supergiants; instead they will destroy themselves as type II supernovas.
data.answer: 在大质量恒星中，在氢燃烧外壳开始时，核心已经足够大，在电子简并压变得普遍之前，氦就会被点燃。因此，当这些恒星膨胀和冷却时，它们不会像低质量恒星那样明亮;然而，它们一开始就比质量较小的恒星要亮得多，因此也比质量较小的恒星形成的红巨星还要亮。这些恒星不太可能以红巨星的身份存在;相反，它们会以第二类超新星的形式自我毁灭。
